00020 struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value
00021 {
00022 #ifdef WINDOWS
00023     HANDLE mutex;
00024 #else
00025     pthread_mutex_t mutex;
00026 #endif
00027 };
00028 #ifdef WINDOWS
00029 static HANDLE *mutex_buf;
00030 #else
00031 static pthread_mutex_t *mutex_buf;
00032 #endif
00033 static void dyn_lock_function(int mode, struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line);
00034 static void dyn_destroy_function(struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line);
00035 static struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *dyn_create_function(const char *file, int line);
00036 static void locking_function(int mode, int n, const char *file, int line);
00037 static unsigned long id_function(void);
00038 SSLServer::SSLServer() 
00039 {
00040         cert_file = "";
00041         priv_key_file = "";
00042         ctx = NULL;
00043 }

00046 SSLServer::SSLServer(char *cFile, char *kFile) 
00047 {
00048         cert_file = cFile;
00049         priv_key_file = kFile;
00050         ctx = NULL;
00051         mutex_buf = NULL;
00052 }

00056 {
00057         return(ctx);

00060 
00061 int SSLServer::tls_init(void)
00062 {
00063     int i;
00064 
00065         SSL_load_error_strings();
00066         SSL_library_init();
00067     // Load algorithms and error strings.
00068         OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
00069     /* static locks area */
00070 #ifdef WINDOWS
00071     mutex_buf = (HANDLE *) malloc(CRYPTO_num_locks() * sizeof(HANDLE));
00072 #else
00073     mutex_buf = (pthread_mutex_t *) malloc(CRYPTO_num_locks() * sizeof(pthread_mutex_t));
00074 #endif
00075     if (mutex_buf == NULL)
00076         return (0);
00077     for (i = 0; i < CRYPTO_num_locks(); i++)
00078     {
00079 #ifdef WINDOWS
00080         mutex_buf[i] = CreateMutex( NULL, FALSE, NULL );
00081 #else
00082         pthread_mutex_init(&mutex_buf[i], NULL);
00083 #endif
00084     }
00085     /* static locks callbacks */
00086     CRYPTO_set_locking_callback(locking_function);
00087     CRYPTO_set_id_callback(id_function);
00088     /* dynamic locks callbacks */
00089     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_create_callback(dyn_create_function);
00090     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_lock_callback(dyn_lock_function);
00091     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_destroy_callback(dyn_destroy_function);
00092 #ifndef WINDOWS
00093     RAND_load_file("/dev/urandom", 1024);
00094 //  OpenSSL uses several sources of entropy automatically on Windows 
00095 #endif
00096     return (1);
00097 }
00098 /**********************************************************************************************/
00099 
00100 int SSLServer::tls_cleanup(void)
00101 {
00102     int i;
00103 
00104     if (mutex_buf == NULL)
00105         return (0);
00106     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_create_callback(NULL);
00107     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_lock_callback(NULL);
00108     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_destroy_callback(NULL);
00109 
00110     CRYPTO_set_locking_callback(NULL);
00111     CRYPTO_set_id_callback(NULL);
00112 
00113     for (i = 0; i < CRYPTO_num_locks(); i++)
00114     {
00115 #ifdef WINDOWS
00116         CloseHandle(mutex_buf[i]);
00117 #else
00118         pthread_mutex_destroy(&mutex_buf[i]);
00119 #endif
00120     }
00121     free(mutex_buf);
00122     mutex_buf = NULL;
00123     return (1);
00124 }

00154 
00155 int SSLServer::CreateCTX(void) 
00156 {
00157 // The method describes which SSL protocol we will be using.
00158 #if (OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x10000000L) // openssl returns a const SSL_METHOD
00159         const SSL_METHOD *method = NULL;
00160 #else
00161         SSL_METHOD *method = NULL;
00162 #endif
00163         STACK_OF(X509_NAME) *cert_names;
00164 
00165         // Compatible with SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLSv1
00166         method = SSLv23_server_method();
00167         //method = TLSv1_server_method();
00168 
00169         // Create new context from method.
00170         ctx = SSL_CTX_new(method);
00171         if(ctx == NULL) 
00172                 return(0);
00173         SSL_CTX_set_mode(ctx,SSL_MODE_AUTO_RETRY);
00174         cert_names = SSL_load_client_CA_file(ca_certificate.c_str());
00175         if (cert_names != NULL)
00176                 SSL_CTX_set_client_CA_list(ctx, cert_names);
00177         else
00178                 return(0);
00179         if(!SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx,ca_certificate.c_str(),NULL))
00180         if(verify_client)
00181                 SSL_CTX_set_verify(ctx,SSL_VERIFY_PEER,0);
00182         return(1);
00183 }
00184 /**********************************************************************************************/
00185 
00186 /* Load the certification files, ie the public and private keys. */
00187 int SSLServer::LoadCerts(void) 
00188 {
00189         if ( SSL_CTX_use_certificate_chain_file(ctx, cert_file.c_str()) <= 0) 
00190                 return(0);
00191         if ( SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey_file(ctx, priv_key_file.c_str(), SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) <= 0) 
00192                 return(0);
00193         // Verify that the two keys goto together.
00194         if ( !SSL_CTX_check_private_key(ctx) ) 
00195                 return(0);
00196         return(1);
00197 }
00198 /**********************************************************************************************/
00208 static void locking_function(int mode, int n, const char *file, int line)
00209 {
00210     if (mode & CRYPTO_LOCK)
00211     {
00212 #ifdef WINDOWS
00213         DWORD dwWaitResult;
00214         dwWaitResult = WaitForSingleObject(mutex_buf[n],INFINITE);
00215 #else
00216         pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex_buf[n]);
00217 #endif
00218     }
00219     else
00220     {
00221 #ifdef WINDOWS
00222         ReleaseMutex(mutex_buf[n]);
00223 #else
00224         pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex_buf[n]);
00225 #endif
00226     }
00227 }
00228 /**********************************************************************************************/
00229 
00235 static unsigned long id_function(void)
00236 {
00237 #ifdef WINDOWS
00238         return(unsigned long) GetCurrentThreadId();
00239         //return(1);
00240 #else
00241     return ((unsigned long) pthread_self());
00242 #endif
00243 }
00244 /**********************************************************************************************/
00245 
00246 static struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *dyn_create_function(const char *file, int line)
00247 {
00248     struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *value;
00249 
00250         value = NULL;
00251     value = (struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *) malloc(sizeof(struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value));
00252     if (!value) 
00253         return(NULL);
00254 #ifdef WINDOWS
00255         value->mutex = CreateMutex( NULL, FALSE, NULL );
00256 #else
00257     pthread_mutex_init(&value->mutex, NULL);
00258 #endif
00259     return value;
00260 }
00261 /**********************************************************************************************/
00262 
00263 static void dyn_lock_function(int mode, struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line)
00264 {
00265     if (mode & CRYPTO_LOCK) 
00266         {
00267 #ifdef WINDOWS
00268         DWORD dwWaitResult;
00269         dwWaitResult = WaitForSingleObject(l->mutex,INFINITE);
00270 #else
00271         pthread_mutex_lock(&l->mutex);
00272 #endif
00273     } 
00274         else 
00275         {
00276 #ifdef WINDOWS
00277         ReleaseMutex(l->mutex);
00278 #else
00279         pthread_mutex_unlock(&l->mutex);
00280 #endif
00281     }
00282 }
00283 /**********************************************************************************************/
00284 
00285 static void dyn_destroy_function(struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line)
00286 {
00287 #ifdef WINDOWS
00288         CloseHandle(l->mutex);
00289 #else
00290     pthread_mutex_destroy(&l->mutex);
00291 #endif
00292     free(l);
00293 }
